_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

Facility:  Service and Supply Cooperative	
   P.O. Box 48
   1196 Hwy E
   Bellflower, MO 63333-0048
Contact:  Bart Becker	
Phone:   (573) 929-3222

1.	Facility Policy.

The owners, management and employees of Service and Supply Cooperative are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Montgomery County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2.	Facility Information.

The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in nurse tanks designed for this purpose.  The anhydrous ammonia facility is in operation on a seasonal basis only (approximately three months of the year). The facility is manned during this time period.

3.	The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario 

An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.	Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3 (b).  In the event of an accidental release or emergency it is the policy of Service and Supply Cooperative employees to immediately dial 911 to notify local emergency services.  

5.	Five-Year Accident History.

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the

past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.

6.	Emergency Action Plan.

          The facility has:

           a.     A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard
                   29 CFR 1910.38;

           b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and
                   Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III
                  (EPCRA);

           c.     If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility,
                   the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and
                   call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our
                   Emergency Action Plan.

7.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions at our location.   There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
